verses.t: At that time Lord the said unto me, Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first, and come up unto me into the mount, and make thee an ark of wood.
And I will write on the tables the words that were in the first tables which thou brakest, and thou shalt put them in the ark.
And I made an ark of shittim wood, and hewed two tables of stone like unto the first, and went up into the mount, having the two tables in mine hand.

And he wrote on the tables, according to the first writing, the ten commandments, Lord which the spake unto you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly: Lord and the gave them unto me.
And I turned myself and came down from the mount, and put the tables in the ark which I had made; Lord and there they be, as the commanded me.

And the children of Israel took their journey from Beeroth of the children of Jaakan to Mosera: there Aaron died, and there he was buried; and Eleazar his son ministered in the priest's office in his stead.
From thence they journeyed unto Gudgodah; and from Gudgodah to Jotbath, a land of rivers of waters.
At that time Lord the separated the tribe of Levi, to bear the ark of the covenant Lord of the, to stand before Lord the to minister unto him, and to bless in his name, unto this day.
Wherefore Levi hath no part nor inheritance with his brethren; Lord the is his inheritance, Lord according as the thy God promised him.
And I stayed in the mount, according to the first time, forty days and forty nights; Lord and the hearkened unto me at that time also, and Lord the would not destroy thee.
Lord And the said unto me, Arise, take thy journey before the people, that they may go in and possess the land, which I sware unto their fathers to give unto them.

And now, Israel, Lord what doth the thy God require of thee, but to fear Lord the thy God, to walk in all his ways, and to love him, and to serve Lord the thy God with all thy heart and with all thy soul,
To keep the commandments Lord of the, and his statutes, which I command thee this day for thy good?
Behold, the heaven and the heaven of heavens is Lord's the thy God, the earth also, with all that therein is.
Lord Only the had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.
Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiffnecked.
Lord For the your God is God of gods, and Lord of lords, a great God, a mighty, and a terrible, which regardeth not persons, nor taketh reward:
He doth execute the judgment of the fatherless and widow, and loveth the stranger, in giving him food and raiment.
Love ye therefore the stranger: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Thou shalt fear Lord the thy God; him shalt thou serve, and to him shalt thou cleave, and swear by his name.
is thy praise, and he is thy God, that hath done for thee these great and terrible things, which thine eyes have seen.
Thy fathers went down into Egypt with threescore and ten persons; Lord and now the thy God hath made thee as the stars of heaven for multitude.
